metalign.voice.hmm

Class HmmVoiceSplittingModelParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • metalign.voice.hmm.HmmVoiceSplittingModelParameters
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<HmmVoiceSplittingModelParameters>

    public class HmmVoiceSplittingModelParameters
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<HmmVoiceSplittingModelParameters>
    The parameters to use for an HmmVoiceSplittingModelState.
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 13 April, 2015

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int BEAM_SIZE
      The beam size for our search.
      double GAP_STD_MICROS
      The standard deviation to use for the Gaussian distribution used to calculate the gap score.
      double MIN_GAP_SCORE
      The minimum possible gap score we will give out.
      double NEW_VOICE_PROBABILITY
      The probability score to return for adding a note to an empty Voice.
      int PITCH_HISTORY_LENGTH
      The number of chords back we want to look in order to determine the weighted pitch.
      double PITCH_STD
      The standard deviation to use for the Gaussian distribution used to calculate the pitch score.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HmmVoiceSplittingModelParameters()
      Create new params with default values for beat-aligned data.
      HmmVoiceSplittingModelParameters(boolean live)
      Create new params with default values for live performance data.

      Create a new params object with the given values.

    • Field Detail

      • MIN_GAP_SCORE

        public final double MIN_GAP_SCORE
        The minimum possible gap score we will give out.

      • PITCH_STD

        public final double PITCH_STD
        The standard deviation to use for the Gaussian distribution used to calculate the pitch score. A pitch gap of exactly this many semitones will result in a Gaussian score of 1/sqrt(e).

      • GAP_STD_MICROS

        public final double GAP_STD_MICROS
        The standard deviation to use for the Gaussian distribution used to calculate the gap score. A gap of exactly this many microseconds will result in a Gaussian score of 1/sqrt(e).

      • PITCH_HISTORY_LENGTH

        public final int PITCH_HISTORY_LENGTH
        The number of chords back we want to look in order to determine the weighted pitch.

      • NEW_VOICE_PROBABILITY

        public final double NEW_VOICE_PROBABILITY
        The probability score to return for adding a note to an empty Voice.

      • BEAM_SIZE

        public final int BEAM_SIZE
        The beam size for our search. It seems that 1 is optimal anyways, so we can remove this probably.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HmmVoiceSplittingModelParameters

        public HmmVoiceSplittingModelParameters(int BS,
                                        double NVP,
                                        int PHL,
                                        double GSM,
                                        double PS,
                                        double MGS)
        Create a new params object with the given values.
